business.headline: EU to hold urgent talks on European industries hit by China's rare earth curbsChina, the world's leading producer of the minerals used to make magnets crucial to the auto, electronics and defence industries, this month announced new controls on the export of rare-earth technologies.

PM's Diwali gift delivered: Nirmala Sitharaman presents GST 2.0 report cardGST Bachat Utsav: Sitharaman, addressing a press conference along with ministers Piyush Goyal and Ashwini Vaishnaw ahead of Diwali, said the GST rate cuts resulted in bumper sales of cars and electronics.

Gold prices near record high on Dhanteras: Should you buy?Gold prices have been on a relentless rally, hitting new record highs almost every day. But does this glittering streak make it the right fit for your investment portfolio this Dhanteras?

Gold flashing a big warning signal: Zoho's Sridhar Vembu says amid rising pricesAs gold prices soar globally, Zoho's Sridhar Vembu raises a red flag. Does the surge signal investor anxiety and eroding trust in the system or reveal a deeper economic fault line?

Gold prices hit record high ahead of Dhanteras, see Rs 3,200 hike in DelhiTraders said gold buying activity picked up sharply as stockists built fresh positions on expectations of higher sales during the festive season.

Why silver utensils, not coins, could help make more moneyWith the price of silver at a record high, silverware might be a potential tax-saving alternative to bars and coins. Personal-use silver utensils are exempt from capital gains tax when sold. Here's what chartered accountants have to say about silver utensils helping investors save on taxes.
Sensex ends 484 points higher, Nifty above 25,700; Asian Paints jumps 4%The S&P BSE Sensex settled 484.53 points higher at 83,952.19, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 124.55 points to close at 25,709.85.

Diwali 2025: From ETFs to SGBs, 5 smart ways to invest in goldWith gold prices at record levels this Diwali, many people are rethinking whether to buy jewellery or look at smarter investment routes. From gold ETFs to SGBs, there are safer and more practical ways to invest without worrying about storage or high-making charges.

Coca-Cola eyes $1 billion IPO for Indian bottling arm: ReportThe discussions are still in early stages, and Coca-Cola has not yet appointed bankers for the deal. The listing could take place as early as next year, though details such as timing, structure, and offer size are still being worked out, the report said.

Why keeping all your money in saving account may be a costly mistake, explains CAMany people believe that money parked in a savings account is the safest option. But an expert warns that this habit could quietly drain your wealth over time, especially when inflation eats into low returns.
EPFO rule change: What's new in PF withdrawals and how it affects youConfused about the new EPFO rules? This guide covers every update, from withdrawal limits to pension changes, in one place.

Dhanteras 2025: Know gold and silver rates in your city before you buyDhanteras is a day when many Indian families choose to bring home gold or silver, believing it invites prosperity and good fortune. From jewellery and coins to small utensils, shoppers often plan their purchases in advance. But with prices running high this season, checking the latest rates in your city has become more important than ever.

Diwali 2025: Planning to buy or gift gold? Know the tax rules firstFrom coins to jewellery, gold remains a favourite Diwali buy. However, not everyone realises that certain tax rules apply when you purchase or gift gold. Knowing these in advance can help you avoid unexpected trouble later.

Sensex surges 700 points: What is the stock market rising today?The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 647.53 points to 94,115.19 around 11:30 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 182.35 points to trade at 25,767.65. Most broader market indices also advanced, though volatility remained elevated.

Buying just gold on Dhanteras? Why you should consider a mutual fund SIPAs Dhanteras's theme shifts from gold to goal-based investing, here is a detailed guide to help investors make smarter, purpose-driven financial choices this festive season.

Big bullion days: Why are gold and silver reaching record highs every day?In India, the timing for the gold and silver rally could not have been more interesting, as the surge comes just ahead of Dhanteras, when buying gold is considered auspicious.

Gold at Rs 1.3 lakh, silver doubles: Is it safe to invest this Diwali?With prices soaring to record highs, the question everyone is asking is whether this Diwali is the right time to buy or if investors are chasing a fleeting festive rally.

Wipro shares plunge nearly 5% despite rise in Q2 net profit. Here's whyAt around 9:30 am, Wipro was trading at Rs 242.12 on the NSE, down 4.6%. The Nifty IT index slipped around 1.2%, weighed down by losses in both Wipro and Infosys.

Sensex, Nifty open lower amid cautious trade; Asian Paints jumps over 3%At around 9:20 am, the S&P BSE Sensex slipped 112.93 points to 83,354.73, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 42.45 points at 25,542.85.

entertainment.headline: Kareena-Karisma, Alia Bhatt and Kapoor Khandan kickstart Diwali in style. Pics The Kapoor family marked Dhanteras with a festive gathering, including Kareena Kapoor, Alia Bhatt, and Karisma Kapoor.  Alia Bhatt and Ibrahim Ali Khan shared glimpses of the celebrations on social media, showing the family's close bonds.

DDLJ at 30: Beyond Shah Rukh Khan's Raj, the women who made the magic last Thirty years since its release, 'DDLJ' continues to be Bollywood's eternal love story, but its women were the real architects of that timelessness. Simran, Lajjo, Chutki, Kammo and Preeti each held up a mirror to what freedom looks like in a patriarchal world. Beyond Raj's romance was their resilience, their laughter, and their silent strength.

BB19 Episode 57: Salman Khan delcares no eviction, Nehal-Baseer bond deepens Actor Salman Khan began a fresh start in 'Bigg Boss 19' following criticisms of the housemates in the previous episode. Diwali surprises and emotional messages brought everyone closer amid rising tensions.

The Ba***ds of Bollywood's Lakshya recalls Aryan Khan would even act the girl's part Actor Lakshya shared experiences working with Aryan Khan on his directorial debut The Ba***ds of Bollywood. Following the show's success, co-writer Bilal Siddiqi also shared a gratitude post as the series completed one month.

Priyanka Chopra expresses joy on nephew's birth, sends love to Parineeti, Raghav Actor Priyanka Chopra shared heartfelt wishes as cousin Parineeti Chopra and husband Raghav Chadha welcomed their baby boy. The arrival has sparked warm congratulations from Bollywood celebrities and fans alike.

KBC 17: Sunil Grover dances with Big B, Krushna jokingly asks about his salary In the upcoming episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17', actor Sunil Grover will be seen grooving to Amitabh Bachchan's iconic songs. Actor-comedian Krushna Abhishek will also join them as Dharmendra.

Sunny Deol turns 68: Bobby, Karan, Esha and Ameesha send warm birthday wishes Actor Sunny Deol celebrated his 68th birthday with warm wishes from family and co-stars. He also unveiled the first look of his upcoming film Gabru, set to release in March 2026.

Bigg Boss 19: Salman Khan says he is still bearing burden of things he never did Actor Salman Khan advised Amaal Mallik to manage his temper after a heated conflict with Farhana Bhatt. The caution highlights the importance of mental strength in handling public criticism and personal behaviour.

Squid Game's Lee Byung-hun poses with SRK, Aamir; fans can't stay calm Shah Rukh Khan posed with 'Squid Game' star Lee Byung Hun and other global celebrities. Fans reacted to Shah Rukh and Aamir Khan's meeting with the South Korean actor.

Parineeti Chopra, Raghav Chadha welcome baby boy: Arms full, hearts fuller Following their recent relocation to Delhi, Parineeti Chopra and Raghav Chadha announced the arrival of their baby boy on Chhoti Diwali via a heartfelt Instagram post.

Samay Raina gifts himself Toyota Vellfire on Dhanteras; joins Aamir, Kriti's league Stand-up comedian Samay Raina celebrated Diwali by buying a luxurious Toyota Vellfire. His purchase signals a strong career comeback after recent public controversies.

Sunny Deol marks 68th birthday with new film Gabru, unveils first look Actor Sunny Deol announces 'Gabru' on his 68th birthday and shares the film's first look on social media. The 'Gadar 2' actor had a midnight celebration with family and fans, highlighted by festive lights and fireworks.

Anupamaa cast upset with Smriti Irani for reportedly demeaning Rupali Ganguly Smriti Irani's comments on not viewing 'Anupamaa' as competition have led to strong responses from the show's cast. Cast members highlighted the need for healthy competition and respect for each other's achievements in the television industry.
Parineeti Chopra admitted to hospital for delivery of her first child: Sources Actor Parineeti Chopra was admitted to the hospital for the delivery of her first child with husband Raghav Chadha.

Kareena, Karisma and Saif at Soha Ali Khan's pre-Diwali celebrations. See pics Soha Ali Khan offered a look into her pre-Diwali festivities with family members, including Saif Ali Khan and Kareena Kapoor Khan. The actor demonstrated a unique approach to Diwali cleaning through her workout routine in the gym.

Palash Muchhal confirms wedding with cricketer Smriti Mandhana Filmmaker and musician Palash Muchhal confirms Smriti Mandhana as his bride-to-be, set to become Indore's daughter-in-law. The couple's relationship has been the subject of speculation for a while, and this announcement marks the first official confirmation.

AP Dhillon shares why he stays away from Bollywood's music industry Singer AP Dhillon has criticised current industry practices, claiming Bollywood exploits Punjabi artists for profit. He stresses the importance of solidarity among senior Punjabi artists to prevent exploitation of younger talent.

30 years after DDLJ: How patriarchal fathers still rule Bollywood Even 30 years after 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge', Bollywood continues to show fathers who control their daughters' marriage choices, reflecting persistent patriarchal norms. Later films like 'Kabir Singh' and '2 States' highlight how toxic fatherhood still influences women's autonomy in love and marriage on screen.

Puneet Issar's moving tribute to Pankaj Dheer: Our bond was stronger than brothers Veteran actor Pankaj Dheer, famed for portraying Karna in 'Mahabharat', died in Mumbai on October 15, 2025 at 68 after battling cancer.  Puneet Issar, his close friend and co-star, shared heartfelt memories and quoted lines from the Mahabharata in tribute.

general news.headline: Delhi says Happy Diwali with toxic air, curbs imposed as areas slip into red zoneOn Sunday, the Commission for Air Quality Management invoked Stage II of the Graded Response Action Plan across Delhi-NCR as the national capital's air quality slipped into the "very poor" category, with the AQI crossing the 300 mark.

They'll keep paying: Trump ups tariff drumbeat over India's Russian oil purchaseUS President Donald Trump has once again warned India of "massive tariffs" if it continues buying oil from Russia, claiming Prime Minister Narendra Modi had assured him of halting such imports, a claim New Delhi has firmly denied.

Harmony, happiness, prosperity and swadeshi push: PM's Diwali message to nationFrom Prime Minister Narendra Modi's call to embrace 'Swadeshi' to record-breaking celebrations in Ayodhya, political leaders marked Diwali with messages of harmony, prosperity, and national pride.

They fired on devotees, we light lamps: Yogi Adityanath jabs Opposition in AyodhyaTaking a dig at the Samajwadi Party and the INDIA bloc at large, Adityanath said those who had "fired bullets" at karsevaks during the Ram Mandir movement never attended the temple's grand opening in 2024.

AUS vs IND: Kuldeep Yadav, India's obvious wicket-taking answer for Adelaide ODIAUS vs IND: After India's 1st ODI loss in Perth exposed a lack of wicket-taking options, the focus turns to Kuldeep Yadav. With 31 wickets against Australia in 23 matches, his inclusion in the 2nd ODI could provide the attacking edge India desperately needs.

Two killed after Turkish cargo plane skids off Hong Kong runway, plunges into seaA Turkish cargo plane skidded off the runway and plunged into the sea at Hong Kong International Airport early Monday killing two people.

Trump boards Air Force One using small stairs after sniper nest found near airportDonald Trump boarded Air Force One quickly on Sunday amid heightened security after the Secret Service found a suspected sniper's nest near Palm Beach airport. The FBI has taken over the probe, weeks after two assassination attempts on Trump raised fresh concerns about his safety.

India implode in Indore, lose three in a row as England reach semisWomen's World Cup, IND vs ENG: India slipped to their third successive defeat in the tournament after losing to England by just four runs on Sunday at the Holkar Stadium in Indore. Heather Knight starred for England, scoring a century in her 300th international appearance.

DDLJ at 30: Beyond Shah Rukh Khan's Raj, the women who made the magic lastThirty years since its release, 'DDLJ' continues to be Bollywood's eternal love story, but its women were the real architects of that timelessness. Simran, Lajjo, Chutki, Kammo and Preeti each held up a mirror to what freedom looks like in a patriarchal world. Beyond Raj's romance was their resilience, their laughter, and their silent strength.

Nomination ride on police vehicle: Case against Tej Pratap for poll code violationAccording to a statement issued by the district police, the Circle Officer of Mahua lodged a complaint with the police station concerned after a video, which went viral on social media, showed Yadav using a SUV, bearing a police logo and a beacon light, during a procession for submitting his documents on October 16.

Parineeti Chopra, Raghav Chadha welcome baby boy: Arms full, hearts fullerFollowing their recent relocation to Delhi, Parineeti Chopra and Raghav Chadha announced the arrival of their baby boy on Chhoti Diwali via a heartfelt Instagram post.

Ashwin slams selection: Where will Kuldeep play, how many all-rounders needed?Former spinner Ravichandran Ashwin criticised India for dropping Kuldeep Yadav in the first ODI against Australia. He highlighted the importance of playing the best bowlers rather than prioritising batting depth.

Kareena-Karisma, Alia Bhatt and Kapoor Khandan kickstart Diwali in style. PicsThe Kapoor family marked Dhanteras with a festive gathering, including Kareena Kapoor, Alia Bhatt, and Karisma Kapoor.  Alia Bhatt and Ibrahim Ali Khan shared glimpses of the celebrations on social media, showing the family's close bonds.

Break legs of disobedient daughters who visit non-Hindus: Pragya Thakur's shockerFormer Bhopal MP Pragya Thakur urged parents to physically punish their daughters, claiming it was for their own better future. She also called upon parents to be "more vigilant" towards "girls who do not follow values" and "are ready to run away from home."

Israel to resume ceasefire, aid after retaliatory strikes on Hamas kill 26 in GazaThe flare-up came the first major test of the ceasefire since it came into effect earlier this month. On Sunday, Israel's military said its troops came under fire from Hamas fighters in southern Gaza, resulting in the deaths of two Israeli soldiers.

Smriti Mandhana takes blame for India's defeat to England: I should have been smarterWomen's World Cup: Smriti Mandhana said that she should have been smarter with her shot selection after India lost to England by four wickets. Mandhana scored 88, but India failed to chase down 289.

River of diyas, chorus of aarti, 2 world records: Ayodhya's Diwali makes historyAyodhya created two records, the lighting of 26,17,215 diyas along with the record for the most people simultaneously performing diya rotation.

He will destroy you: Trump cursed, threw map urging Zelenskyy to accept Putin dealDonald Trump reportedly pressed Volodymyr Zelenskyy to accept Russia's terms to end the war, warning that Vladimir Putin would destroy Ukraine if it refused. In a tense White House meeting, Trump reportedly cursed, threw maps, and echoed Putin's proposals.

Pregnant woman stabbed by lover in Delhi; husband snatches knife, kills attackerAccording to police, the pregnant woman, Shalini, was attacked multiple times with a knife by her former live-in partner, Aashu, in Delhi's Nabi Karim area late on Saturday night. In a desperate bid to save his wife, the husband intervened and fatally injured the attacker, who was declared dead on arrival at the hospital.

Basket lift, disc cutter: How Louvre robbers carried out brazen 4-minute heistThieves executed a rapid four-minute robbery at the Louvre Museum in Paris, stealing Napoleon-era jewels using a basket lift and disc cutter. The incident highlights renewed concerns over museum security and public safety.

How a coconut crisis is changing the taste of IndiaCoconut prices have exploded across India, leaving households and hawkers equally stunned. The coconut crisis is reflected in crispy banana chips to everyday curries and chutneys. What's causing this steep surge, and how long will the naryial crunch last?

Why Amit Shah's take on Nitish Kumar's future is weightier than everAmit Shah's layered remarks on the NDA's next Bihar CM and Nitish's health reveal deft coalition strategy and, perhaps, the course of the government to come

Steve Jobs named a computer after his daughter, but denied she existedIn 1978, Steve Jobs denied that he was the father of his newborn daughter, Lisa, even as Apple secretly developed a $50 million computer with the same name. Decades later, Lisa Brennan-Jobs's memoir Small Fry revealed how her father's denial, cruelty, and late confession became Silicon Valley's most human story.

Internal rift in Bihar Congress? Party MLA accuses leaders of bribe for ticketsAlam has levelled serious allegations against Bihar Congress chief Rajesh Ram, state in-charge Krishna Allavaru, and legislative party leader Shakeel Ahmed Khan.

Bangladesh confident of beating Sri Lanka, did so in practice-match: Fahima Khatun Women's World Cup 2025: Fahima Khatun believes Bangladesh batters can take confidence from their thrilling one-run win over Sri Lanka in the World Cup practice match. She says the victory sets the tone for their must-win clash.

Women's World Cup: How India can qualify for semis. Explained Women's World Cup, IND vs ENG: India lost to England by four runs on Sunday at the Holkar Stadium in Indore, but are still in with a decent chance of qualifying for the semi-final.

India's Indore collapse: Mandhana, Deepti under fire for poor judgement calls vs ENG India came agonisingly close to a record chase but lost by four runs to England. Crucial batting errors under pressure proved costly in the Women's World Cup match.

Smriti Mandhana's wicket was the turning point vs England: Harmanpreet Kaur Women's World Cup, IND vs ENG: Harmanpreet Kaur said that losing Smriti Mandhana's wicket was a key moment in their clash against England where the Women in Blue lost by four runs at the Holkar Stadium in Indore.

Manchester United defy odds to stun pricey Liverpool 2-1, ending 10-year Anfield wait Manchester United shocked Liverpool at Anfield with a 2-1 win. Bryan Mbeumo's early strike and Harry Maguire's late header sealed a memorable victory for Amorim's side.

India should not press panic button after Perth ODI loss: Varun Aaron urges calm Varun Aaron urged fans and team management to stay calm after India's opening ODI loss in Perth. The former pacer said the defeat is just a minor setback and expects veterans Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma to bounce back strongly.

Heather Knight starred for England, scoring a century in her 300th international appearance.

Perth ODI win was solid, but India still capable of a comeback: Matthew KuhnemannAustralia's Matthew Kuhnemann lauded his team's dominant Perth ODI win but warned against complacency, acknowledging India's proven ability to fight back. The left-arm spinner said Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's experience makes India dangerous ahead of the Adelaide clash.

Virat Kohli, don't argue with yourself after Perth ODI flopshow: Matthew HaydenAUS vs IND: Matthew Hayden urged Virat Kohli to trust his technique after the Perth ODI setback. He stressed that one poor innings shouldn't undermine Kohli's confidence as India head into the Adelaide ODI against Australia.

Shubman Gill is like Rohit Sharma, both are bowler's captains: Arshdeep SinghArshdeep Singh reflected on how both Shubman Gill and Rohit Sharma are as captains, suggesting that both are leaders who give total freedom to their bowlers to execute their plans.

Virat Kohli will score runs vs Australia, form is just a word to him: Arshdeep SinghArshdeep Singh expresses strong belief in Virat Kohli's ability to perform in the ongoing ODI series against Australia. Despite Kohli's early dismissal, the team expects him to rebound and lead India's batting charge.

Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's comeback in Adelaide ODI won't surprise me: GavaskarSunil Gavaskar believes Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma can recover after their Perth ODI flop. Despite challenging conditions, the experience of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma could make the Adelaide ODI a thrilling comeback.

How Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma failed against Australia, once againIndia vs Australia: Australia fast bowlers once again had the number of the Indian top-order. Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli and Shubman Gill failed in India's return to the ODI format.

Won't be too harsh on Kohli and Rohit for Perth ODI flop: Sunil GavaskarAUS vs IND: Indian cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar refused to be too critical of the legendary duo Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's forgetful ODI return in the Perth ODI vs Australia. He highlighted how the Perth pitch troubled every Indian batter, and the duo weren't the only victims.

AUS vs IND: Harshit Rana faces the wrath of social media after poor show in PerthHarshit Rana faced heavy criticism for his bowling in the ODI opener against Australia in Perth. His loose deliveries and lack of wickets raised doubts about his place in the Indian team.

He highlighted how the Perth pitch troubled every Indian batter, and the duo weren't the only victims.

AUS vs IND: Harshit Rana faces the wrath of social media after poor show in PerthHarshit Rana faced heavy criticism for his bowling in the ODI opener against Australia in Perth. His loose deliveries and lack of wickets raised doubts about his place in the Indian team.

Australia spoil Gill's ODI captaincy debut as Rohit, Kohli flop on comebackAustralia vs India, 1st ODI: Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli looked rusty on their return to international cricket, while the rest of India's batting line-up appeared undercooked as the pace and bounce in Perth proved too hot to handle. Australia cruised to a seven-wicket win, chasing 131 with ease in a rain-affected match on Sunday to take a 1–0 lead in the three-match series.

Rain, chaos and DLS confusion: Fans outraged as India's total slashed by 5 runsFans were left outraged by how India's first-innings total was slashed down by five runs despite the innings being delayed due to rain on four occasions with many questioning whether the DLS method is legitimate or not.

Pakistan lashes out at ICC for biased statement in solidarity with AfghanistanThe ICC and BCCI on Saturday condoled the deaths of Afghan cricketers in an aerial attack in Paktika Province, without mentioning Pakistan. Pakistan's Information Minister dismissed the statements, saying Afghanistan had claimed the deaths of three local cricketers without providing evidence.

Rohit, Gill share popcorn bucket during rain break, commentator has a laughAustralia vs India, 1st ODI: During one of the multiple rain breaks on Sunday, Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli were seen having a lengthy chat in the dressing room, sharing a bucket of popcorn. Both Rohit and Shubman Gill were dismissed cheaply in the series opener in Perth.

IND vs ENG Highlights: England beat India to qualify for semisWomen's World Cup, India (IND) vs England (ENG) Highlights: England have sealed their spot in the semi-final, and that came after a brilliant win over India by just 4 runs. India looked poised to grab the win, but yet again their lower-order mishaps cost them the match.

No vadapav, 800 reps daily: Rohit trained like a bodybuilder for ODI comebackAfter months away from international cricket, Rohit Sharma returned leaner, lighter and hungrier. Under the watchful eye of Abhishek Nayar, the former India captain endured a punishing three-hour daily routine, swapping his beloved vadapav for 800-rep workouts in a bid to extend his career to the 2027 World Cup.

Rohit, Kohli told to take MS Dhoni route after flopping on ODI returnRohit Sharma and Virat Kohli have been advised to draw inspiration from MS Dhoni and play domestic cricket for better match practice after failing on their ODI return against Australia.

Did Mitchell Starc just bowl the fastest ball in ODI history to Rohit Sharma?India vs Australia: Australia fast bowler Mitchell Starc bowled a brilliant morning spell against the India batters. One of his deliveries was clocked at 176.5 kmph.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
